original: Falk, Nils, öveirisite, Gulilimiarisbeirgs’ säteri, Skredsvik, f. 1/5/98 i KarLsboTg, Skarab. 1., av kapt. Sven F. o. Elin Bredelius. G. 29 m. Maja Pehrsison. Barn: Birgitta f. 30, Gunilila 38. — Stud:ex. 16, off :ex. 18. Fänrik v. Skarab. reg. 18, ilöjtn. 20, kapt. 33, v. gen:stab. 316, Gotl. inf :reg. 38, major v. gen:’Stab. 40, övrlöjtn. där 42, v. Liv-gren :reg. 43, överste på res :>stat 47. Förste adjut. h. chef. f. försv.-istab. 37-38, stabisch. v. VIL mil :befäkstab. 40-43. RSO, RVO, GGI, SS.
translated: Falk, Nils, over-officer, owner of Gulilimiarisbeirgs' estate, Skredsvik, born on May 1st, 1898 in Karlstorp, Skaraborg County, son of Captain Sven F. and Elin Bredelius. Married to Maja Persson in 1929. They had two children: Birgitta, born in 1930, and Gunilla, born in 1938. Nils passed his exam from secondary school in 1916 and his officer exam in 1918. He served in the Skaraborg regiment as an ensign from 1918, as a lieutenant from 1920, and as a captain from 1933. He was a deputy general staff officer from 1936, served in the Gotland Infantry Regiment nr 38 and was promoted to major in the general staff in 1940. He was appointed as a lieutenant colonel in the same year, served in the Life Grenadier Regiment and was appointed as a colonel in the reserve in 1947. He was the first adjutant to the chief of defense staff from 1937-1938, staff officer at the military command of Vilhelm III from 1940-1943. Nils was awarded the Orders of Vasa, Sword, and the Seraphim.

structured.name: Nils Falk
structured.description: Over-officer and owner of Gulilimiarisbeirgs' estate in Skredsvik. Nils passed his exam from secondary school in 1916 and his officer exam in 1918. He was appointed as a lieutenant colonel in the same year, served in the Life Grenadier Regiment and was appointed as a colonel in the reserve in 1947. He was the first adjutant to the chief of defense staff from 1937-1938, staff officer at the military command of Vilhelm III from 1940-1943. Nils was awarded the Orders of Vasa, Sword, and the Seraphim.
